statement:
Index Set Theorem: *If $A$ is an index set and
$A\neq\varnothing, \omega$, then either $K\leq_1 A$ or
$K\leq_1 A^{\complement}$.*

In the statement of the theorem, $K$ is the halting set
$\{x : \varphi_x(x)\: converges \}$, $\leq_1$ is the one-one
reducibility (or 1-reducibility) relation symbol, and $A^{\complement}$
stands for the complement of the set $A$ (relative to $\omega$).
